chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurice Demar Crawford

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Activity:  Arraignment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:13 AM  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video supervising intern Verity Altenberger by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Laurice Demar Crawford appeared by video.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Laurice Demar Crawford. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered and jury trial to be set.

Activity: Preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:33 AM Defendant Laurice Demar Crawford in court by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Alexander David Goulart appeared by video Officer Dillon Hagstrom of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Arraignment scheduled on July 12, 2022 at 10AM.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Activity:Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:01 PM Defendant Laurice Demar Crawford in court by video  with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S Olson  and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:47 PM Defendant Laurice Demar Crawford in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Jason D Sanders and legal intern Olivia Long appearing by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Co Defendants Rasheen Jackson or Kenneth Crawford. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned Initial Appearance June 15, 2033 at 1:00 PM.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Co Defendants Rasheen Jackson or Kenneth Crawford.
